101.description: Get your badge, enjoy talking with tech addicts around
101.title: Welcome and Check-in

102.description: This talk will focus on the evolution of cloud, where it's headed in the next few years and steps to build a sustainable career in cloud.
102.title: Keynote - How to build a career in cloud

103.description: Setting up tech for the next session
103.title: Tech Setup

104.description: Panelists Janine Lee and Sherry Yang will be discussing their experiences as women and leaders in the tech industry, how to be a better ally for women and minorities in tech, and how to create opportunity pipelines for women, including gender-inclusive interviewing and hiring practices. Moderated by Chryssa Jones.
104.title: Women Techmakers Panel: Gender Inclusion in Tech

105.description: Learn about the recent developments happening at the Angular framework
105.title: State of Angular

201.description: I will demo how you can backup data from Workspace into Google Cloud Storage
201.title: Using Cloud Storage to reduce Google Workspace license costs

106.description: Lit's CSS system combines several web platform features to provide one of the fastest, lightweight and most powerful styling systems out there. Learn how Lit's CSS system provides scoping, modules and shared styles, variables, automatic bundler support, and lets you build your own abstractions with functions and JavaScript. And it's all available with no build system, using standard CSS syntax, and it's built with just dozens of lines of JavaScript.
106.title: Lit CSS is Super-powered

202.description: Large language models trained on code have shown very promising results! This talk will cover what work is being done by the research community in this area. An overview of the state-of-the-art in this area, as well as recent work done by DeepMind, Google Research, Meta, OpenAI, and Microsoft Research will be presented.
202.title: A survey of the state of the art in language models for code

107.description: A gentle introduction to gRPC, beginning with underlying concepts and ending with a couple of demos.
107.title: An Introduction to gRPC with Go

203.description: In this talk, Hannes Hapke, lead machine learning engineer from Digits introduces similarity based machine learning. He’ll explain how Digits is using similarity learning to build the next generation of finance tools. Hannes shares the team’s learning about the implementation, training, deployment, production aspects and how the team integrated the product end-to-end with Google Cloud.
203.title: Similarity based Machine Learning

204.description: This talk provides an introduction of how AI can be used to assist and inspire the artists and designers in their creative space. You will also learn how to use advanced features of TensorFlow 2.x, Keras and TensorFlow Lite to train and deploy models to applications. This talk is for anyone: data scientists, ML engineers, artists or designers who are interested in applying deep learning models for generative art & design. Topics covered: Generative art and design, TensorFlow 2.x and Keras, TensorFlow Lite and on-device ML
204.title: Generative Art and Design with TensorFlow

109.description: Angular now has Standalone Components, and this back to the future themed talk will teach you all about how they work.
109.title: Simplifying Angular with Standalone Components

205.description: What is real-time machine learning, the state of real-time machine learning, its infrastructural challenges, and possible solutions.
205.title: Real-time Machine Learning

priyanka_vergadia.bio: Priyanka is a technical storyteller and content creator who has created over 300 videos, articles, podcasts, courses and tutorials which help developers learn Google Cloud fundamentals, solve their business challenges and pass certifications! Checkout her content on Google Cloud Tech Youtube channel. Priyanka enjoys drawing and painting which she tries to bring to her advocacy.
priyanka_vergadia.name: Priyanka Vergadia
priyanka_vergadia.title: Chief Content Officer

chryssa_jones.bio: Chryssa Jones is a full-stack web developer based in Honolulu, Hawai'i, the ancestral lands of her own people. As a native Hawaiian educator and web developer, Chryssa creates web-based and mobile applications to support the normalization of indigenous languages and culturally-grounded education. Her professional background also includes extensive experience in higher education administration, teaching, data analysis, small-business and retail management, manufacturing and operations, community development and public speaking. Outside of work, Chryssa volunteers her time as a Women Techmakers Ambassador and coordinator for GDG Oahu, is involved in community politics and neighborhood events, has a commercial pilot’s license, and loves to travel, garden, spend as much time outdoors as possible, and hang out with her family.
chryssa_jones.name: Chryssa Jones
chryssa_jones.shortBio: Chryssa Jones is a full-stack web developer based in Honolulu, Hawai'i
chryssa_jones.title: Solutions Engineer and Design Lead

mark_thompson.bio: Mark loves to teach and code. His love for both of these disciplines has led to becoming an award winning university instructor and software engineer. He comes with a passion for creating meaningful learning experiences. With over a decade of developing solutions across the tech stack, Mark likes to use that experience to break down fear of technology and make challenging technical topics more accessible. Lately, Mark has been spending time creating a disruptive fitness community by building Totally Strong, Inc. and working as a Developer Advocate at Google.
mark_thompson.name: Mark Thompson
mark_thompson.shortBio: Mark loves to teach and code.
mark_thompson.title: Developer Advocate for Angular

mark_johnson.bio: With a total of over 20 years of IT Experience I've spent the last 10 years being a passionate, customer-facing Google Cloud Evangelist, Engineer & Authorized Trainer working with all types of clients from different industries. Expert problem solver adept at using Google Cloud technologies and best practices to support Enterprise organizations. Early adopter and technology enthusiast with a passion for learning!
mark_johnson.name: Mark Johnson
mark_johnson.shortBio: Expert problem solver adept at using Google Cloud technologies and best practices
mark_johnson.title: Solutions Architect and Google Cloud Trainer

justin_fagnani.bio: Justin is the lead of the Lit core libraries on Google's web components team. He contributes to web component standards, the Web Components Community Group and previously worked Polymer tools, Dart, and Google App Maker.
justin_fagnani.name: Justin Fagnani
justin_fagnani.shortBio: Justin is the lead of the Lit core libraries on Google's web components team.
justin_fagnani.title: Software engineer on Lit and web components

daniel_goncharov.bio: Dan is a Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning. He is passionate about data science and ML, and is always looking for interesting problems to solve. His areas of interest include deep learning, computer vision, natural language processing, and time series analysis.
daniel_goncharov.name: Daniel Goncharov
daniel_goncharov.shortBio: Dan is a Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning.
daniel_goncharov.title: Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning

easwar_swaminathan.bio: Easwar is a software engineer on the gRPC-Go team in Google. In a previous iteration, he was a software engineer on the Cloud Databases team in Google. His interests include networking, distributed systems and Go among others
easwar_swaminathan.name: Easwar Swaminathan
easwar_swaminathan.shortBio: Easwar is a software engineer on the gRPC-Go team in Google.
easwar_swaminathan.title: Software Engineer

hannes_hapke.bio: Hannes Hapke is a machine learning engineer at Digits, where he develops innovative ways to use machine learning to boost the productivity for business owners and accountants. Prior to joining Digits, Hannes solved machine learning infrastructure problems in various industries including healthcare, retail, recruiting, and renewable energies. Additionally, Hannes actively contributes to TensorFlow's TFX Addons project, and has co-authored machine learning publications including the book on 'Building Machine Learning Pipeline'.
hannes_hapke.name: Hannes Hapke Hapke
hannes_hapke.shortBio: Hannes Hapke is a machine learning engineer at Digits.
hannes_hapke.title: Machine Learning Engineer

simeon_vincent.bio: I'm a web technologist, an open web supporter, and a nascent open source contributor driven to write code, learn, and help others.
simeon_vincent.name: Simeon Vincent
simeon_vincent.title: Developer Advocate for Chrome Extensions

margaret_reid.bio: Margaret is an ML GDE (Google Developers Expert) and ML engineer working on applying AI/ML to real-world applications from art and design, climate change to society safety. She is also an avid artist who creates traditional, digital, and AI art. She writes and speaks at conferences about deep learning, computer vision, TensorFlow and on-device ML. She leads GDG Seattle and Seattle Data/Analytics/Machine Learning.
margaret_reid.name: Margaret Maynard-Reid
margaret_reid.shortBio: ML engineer applying AI to art and design
margaret_reid.title: ML engineer

jessica_janiuk.bio: Jessica Janiuk is a senior software engineer at Google based in the San Francisco Bay Area. In her free time she is a photographer, historical fencer, cosplayer, and droid builder. She's known for her puns.
jessica_janiuk.name: Jessica Janiuk
jessica_janiuk.shortBio: Punster | Angular Framework Team at Google
jessica_janiuk.title: Software engineer at Angular Framework Team

chloe_he.bio: Chloe graduated from Stanford University in 2022, with a Master's in Biomedical Informatics. She is currently a Founding Machine Learning Engineer at Claypot AI, building a platform for real-time machine learning.
chloe_he.name: Chloe He
chloe_he.title: Founder Engineer

sherry_yang.bio: Sherry is a polyglot programmer, who can adapt to languages, frameworks, and stacks in less than two weeks. She worked with JavaScript, Python, Django, Golang, React, Angular, Node.js, Ember.js, Jade, SASS, C/C++, C#/.NET, MongoDB, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, Arm Mbed, PHP, Elasticsearch, BrowserStack, Selenium, and the list goes on. Some of Sherry’s interested roles in tech is product management and project management which allow her to orchestrate an idea to reality and utilize her attention to details to ensure success. Sherry’s motivation is in creative solutions which impact the world in sustainability, education, and culture. Sherry most recently got promoted to a leadership role as an Engineering Team Lead with Adaptavist. Outside of work as a Women Techmakers Ambassador, Sherry actively connects people in the tech industry, focuses on empowering people with digital skills, and helps others recognize their growth potential. Sherry's tech career has been a roller coaster ride with various startups working with the latest technologies. Sherry is run by curiosity and always finds ways to discover a new path professionally and personally.
sherry_yang.name: Sherry Yang
sherry_yang.shortBio: Sherry is a polyglot programmer, who can adapt to languages, frameworks, and stacks in less than two weeks.
sherry_yang.title: Engineering Team Lead | WTM Ambassador

janine_lee.bio: Janine Lee (she/her) is the Founder at Capture the Dream, Inc., a nonprofit that helps low-income youth achieve their educational endeavors. In the past 12 years, Capture the Dream, Inc. has helped thousands of low-income youth by sponsoring backpack school supply drives, micro-grants towards educational goals, free educational field trips, mentorship, and scholarship programs. 'Growing up in Oakland, I would have been sent to a public school that had a 50% drop-out rate. I was fortunate enough to have parents who could afford to send me to a private school for a better education. Not everyone in life has that opportunity. I want to be able to give that opportunity to others so they can get the resources, support, and mentorship they need to succeed. I believe that education can help break the cycle of poverty.'
janine_lee.name: Janine Lee
janine_lee.shortBio: Global L&D Leader @ Google | Leadership Dev | Adjunct Professor | Executive Coach | Continuous Improvement | Doctorate Candidate
janine_lee.title: Global Learning and Development Manager

tickets.info: Online or in-person at Hacker Dojo
tickets.name: Hybrid Admission
